meanings.definition: Of doubtful or uncertain quality or validity.
meanings.sent1: The weather forecast for tomorrow is iffiest, so we might need to bring both an umbrella and sunglasses.
meanings.sent2: Her excuse for being late was the iffiest I've ever heard.
meanings.sent3: The iffiest part of the magic show was when the magician made a rabbit disappear but couldn't bring it back.
meanings.sent4: The iffiest bridge in town is known for its creaking and swaying in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The iffiest piece of advice I ever received was to invest all my money in a risky startup company.

meanings.sent1: The iffiest decision he made was to quit his stable job without a backup plan.
meanings.sent2: The future of the project looks iffiest when considering the lack of funding.
meanings.sent3: The iffiest part of the movie was when the main character suddenly started speaking in a foreign language.
meanings.sent4: Her trust in him was the iffiest thread holding their friendship together.
meanings.sent5: The iffiest path through the forest was overgrown and full of hidden obstacles.
